title: Latest updates: Derbyshire Live on Wednesday 22 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: road still closed in chester green after burst water main .
derby pupils educated on grooming risks .
homeowners warned after mirror causes house fire .
derby expected to see school funding rise .
ex-football coach barry bennell denies 20 child sex offences .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for derbyshire and east staffordshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : outbreaks of rain
text: tonight will be cloudy with outbreaks of showery rain at times .
winds will ease in the early hours with a chance of a few patches of mist and fog forming at times .
minimum temperature : 5c ( 41f )
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: westminster terror attack : most local mp 's accounted for
text: most of our local mps were in the main chamber of parliament preparing to vote at the time of the attack .
so far we 've heard from
the north east derbyshire mp natascha engel was in portcullis house and said she was close to the sounds of gunshots and it was terrifying .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: cricket : derbys ditch dubai for home comforts
text: derbyshire abandoned their regular pre-season tour to sunnier climates and opted to stay closer to home to hone their skills .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: watch : ice rinklies skating for the over 60s
text: over 60 and thinking about ice skating ?
it 's never too late .
the ice rinklies ice skating group has been launched for people aged over 60 .
they hope to encourage more elderly people to take up the sport .
lynn emmett a member of the ice rinklies meets twice a week in uttoxeter to practice and learn new skills .
she returned to the ice after retirement and hopes to still be skating at the age of 90 .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: burton mp thanks police and security services
text: thank you to all the police & security services who are doing everything they can to keep us all safe .
well now would be a time to consider investment in the police , rather than the years of erosion suffered by your govt .
despite them hating you for decimating the police service , and pensions/wages
stay safe , thoughts to you and colleagues .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: firm 'illegally felled ' protected trees
text: a company has been served with a court injunction after protected trees were cut down at a caravan park in the derwent valley .
amber valley borough council visited haytop country park , whatstandwell , on friday , and told workers the trees were subject to tree preservation orders .
however , despite being told to `` stop immediately '' , the authority said workers cut down more over the weekend .
the bbc has made several attempts to contact the park 's owners countrywide park homes for a comment .
the leicestershire-based firm bought the site , which has 60 pitches for touring and static caravans , in october .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: high peak mp locked inside chamber
text: high peak mp locked inside chamber
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rams striker left out of final czech republic squad
text: derby county striker matej vydra has been left out of the final czech republic squad for their upcoming matches against lithuania and san marino .
vydra had been named in the preliminary squad last week .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: police investigate assault on female jogger in belper
text: attack alarms are being given to running clubs in derbyshire after a second assault on a female jogger in a week .
a woman was forced into an alleyway and assaulted as she ran along whitemoor lane , in belper , yesterday between 20:30 and 20:45 .
offiers are investigating whether the assault is linked to a recent attack on a. woman jogging alongside cromford canal .
officers are keen to speak to drivers or pedestrians who were in belper and noticed anything sus
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : sleet and hail showers this afternoon
text: rain pushing in throughout the afternoon with some heavier downpours possible at times which could also involve sleet and hail .
highs of 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: paramedic sexually assaulted in ambulance
text: a patient who sexually assaulted a female paramedic while he was being treated in the back of an ambulance has been jailed .
darshit tanna , 28 , from derby , `` grabbed her breast twice '' while the woman was trying to help him last june , derby crown court heard .
he was being treated by east midlands ambulance service ( emas ) for breathing difficulties at the time .
he pleaded guilty to sexual assault and assault against a male member of emas , who was trying to protect her .
tanna was jailed for 18 months and added to the sex offenders register for 10 years .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: bus diversions in place following a609 accident
text: this is still causing problems
we have just been informed of an accident at west hallam crossroads nr millhouse garage we are diverting via west hallam village ~nic
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new plans to develop former american adventure theme park site
text: plans to develop the former american adventure theme park site , near ilkeston , are likely to go before councillors later this year .
the site closed in 2007 and has been empty ever since - despite a campaign to bring another theme park to the area .
amber valley borough council is expecting a planning application for a mix of up to 300 homes and retail space .
what are your memories of the theme park ? .
let me know .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: cctv released after pub baseball bat incident
text: a cctv image has been released of a man police are keen to speak to in connection with an incident involving a baseball bat at a pub in hasland .
he was in the devonshire arms in mansfield road when another man walked in and swung a baseball bat around .
during the incident , a pub-goer was pushed to the floor and suffered facial injuries .
officers believe the man might have information relating to the incident and are keen to speak to him .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: complications in fixing chester green burst water main
text: this 10-inch wide pipe - which burst at the weekend , damaging homes - has caused severn trent workers a bit of a headache .
because the pipe has an unusual curve and is n't a standard fitting , it 's taking longer to fix the problem on mansfield road in chester green than expected .
a spokesman said they need to make sure nothing is there that should n't be and they are making sure everything is clear from a larger pipe which the 10-inch pipe connects to .
but they are confident the service will resume later on today .
householders experiencing low pressure will find things back to normal once the repair is complete .
the road closure will remain closed and may reopen by the weekend severn trent said .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'fewer carriages ' on some east midlands trains services
text: worth casting your eye over this if you are travelling later
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ex-football coach barry bennell denies 20 child sex offences
text: former football coach barry bennell has denied 20 child sex offences .
the 63-year-old appeared via videolink from prison at chester crown court .
some of the alleged offences are said to have happened at furness vale in north derbyshire .
mr bennell already denied eight charges but entered not guilty pleas again to the 12 further accusations and was remanded into custody .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warning for homeowners after mirror causes house fire
text: staffordshire fire and rescue service is warning householders about placing mirrors in direct sunlight - after a fire in rolleston .
firefighters say the reflected light from a mirror caused a bedroom blind in the house to burn .
the incident happened in the bedroom of the property on beacon road in rolleston-on-dove at 07:45 yesterday .
crews managed to put out the fire before it could spread .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: broken down vehicle closes lane on m1 northbound
text: one of four lanes is currently closed on the m1 northbound between junction 28 for alfreton and 29 for chesterfield because of a broken down vehicle .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby expected to see school funding rise
text: derby is one of the areas expected to see the total funding shared by schools to rise by about 2.4 % .
in the first year of the biggest shake-up of school funding in england for decades .
of the city 's 87 schools , 85 will get more money under sweeping proposals by the department for education ( dfe ) .
the dfe said the proposals would ensure `` every pound of the investment we make in education has the greatest impact '' .
education secretary justine greening says the old system is `` unfair '' as similar schools can get different levels of funding with `` little or no justification '' .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : chester green road still closed
text: it looks like sunday 's water main burst .
is still affecting traffic within the area as mansfield road is still currently closed .
yesterday , severn trent water said it will probably be `` a couple of days '' before the road can reopen .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: murder victim 's mum educates pupils on grooming risks
text: pupils from queen elizabeth grammar school in ashbourne have been learning lessons on internet safety .
they were joined by lorin lafave from surrey whose .
teenage son breck bednar was murdered after being groomed online .
she spoke to the children about the dangers of online grooming and how to stay safe whilst using the net .
staff at the school believe internet safety awareness should be just as important as english and maths .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : queuing traffic on a38 and a61
text: there is currently long queuing traffic at the little eaton island on the a38 and delays on the a61 and pentagon island coming into derby .
author: BBC News Travel

text: looks like a beautiful start to the day in alvaston .
this fabulous shot of the sunrise was taken by johnbalvaston .
if you have any snaps then send them our way .
